reviewText: I am surprised that Celtic legends can be lowered to such a horridly low point when they start to look like Power Rangers. Just like Power Rangers, "Mystic Knights of Tir Na Nog" features plenty of problems  coupled with witless plots and senseless acting. The realism is nearly  non-existent - the dragons look like they were taken from a low-grade  science fiction featurette ( they don't breath gouts of flame - they shoot  projectiles! ), the weaponry, armor, and barding is completely loose and  looks like it's ready to fall off (especially the helm on the Knightess of  Air, which is several sizes too large), and the characters are simply  laughable ( one of the Knights is black. I see the point of preventing all  racism, but, come on! , these are supposed to be Celts! ). The acting is  simply idiotic, the scripts have gaping holes and uniteresting lines, and,  best of all, only half of the characters can speak with a half-way proper  Irish accent.I beg of you, please DO NOT buy this!
Title: N/A

reviewText: It has been ages since I've seen this show and I enjoyed every minute of it! I think I actually watched this more than Power Rangers In Space at the time (I don't know if I'm right about that, the last time I saw this show was 15 years ago). I was surprised that this doesn't start off with the first two episodes, which I think hurts it since those who don't remember or haven't seen the show will wonder how the Knights already have their weapons. The four episodes featured detail how each hero gains their respective armor and it does get repetitive but it still entertains. The acting is pretty good for a show like this,  we've gotten worse from other Saban shows, haven't we Masked Rider?On the production side, the CGI for the monsters is terrible! Did they blow the costume budget on the armor and the Temra Sentinels? Couldn't they have just re-used monster suits from Power Rangers and Big Bad Beetleborgs? I don't knock the show for its effort in the effects department I give Saban major credit for doing an original tokusatsu-style show from scratch AND actually filming in Ireland which I know wasn't cheap but they could've brought down production costs by re-using old monster suits (they've done it before on other productions with monsters from Beetleborgs popping up in Power Rangers).It was a nice stroll down memory lane for me and I do think that this was the best of the Ranger spin-offs, though it wouldn't take much to be better than Masked Rider or VR Troopers. A shame it didn't last longer, it had another season left in it (which it was supposed to get but it's budget ended up going to Power Rangers: Lost Galaxy).
summary: The Last Power Ranger Spin-Off Is Surprisingly The Best

reviewText: This is nothing more then a Power Rangers rip-off. It was just cashing in on the success of said show. Aside from that,the cast is bland & forgettable,the fights are luke-warm and the villian is 1D at best. Infact This whole show is forgettable. I mean,how many of you actually remember this show? I give this show a 0 out of 10.

reviewerName: Someone who'd rather much see Andrea Bocelli ...
reviewText: Nobody around here cares for these guys anymore than I and other admirers do. That's why I feel sorry for them. Saban probably didn't want nothing more to do with them after Lost Galaxy, so in August 1999, he took them off the air, right when Nemain, the "new" Queen of Temra, booted Maeve out of the Caste of Temra and took her throne.Now what? How come there's been no word on when the legacy will continue? How come those bulls**t Digimon are the ONLY things that matter on Fox Kids TV? Look, I know sooner or later, you have to move on to the next best thing, but COME ON! Please take a note from the Pokémon. At least they're still on the air even with all those new episodes they've been putting out and whilst they've gone downhill thanks to the rotten Digimon. I still have all the action figures from last year. God forbid, if there were a Mystic Knight of Thunder, especially if it's a girl (my favorite Mystic Knight is Deirdre even though the whole cast is awesome), I'd LOVE to see that. I even have the video, which I've seen many times and even brings tears to my eyes at times knowing the obsession I've had with them and how I wish they were still on the air, even though it's only a TV show. It's nothing, though, compared to my obsession with Andrea Bocelli. You won't want to know how hard I've cried many nights just thinking about him.And not even a movie yet? I see the Pokémon, Power Rangers, and Digimon getting big-screen movies, but then, that's because they're way more popular than these guys. The Powerpuff Girls might get one, too. Actually, I like two of the Powerpuff Girls, namely Blosson and Bubbles. It's getting late, so let me get out of here.
summary: I DON'T CARE WHAT ANYONE ELSE THINKS!
